meanings.definition: To outwit or outmaneuver someone in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: She outjockeyed her opponent by thinking quickly and making a strategic move.
meanings.sent2: The skilled chess player outjockeyed his rival by anticipating every move.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outjockeyed the hunter by leading him on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: In the game of wits, she outjockeyed her friends with her cunning tactics.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outjockey his competitors made him a formidable opponent in the business world.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outperform someone in a competition or contest.
meanings.sent1: The athlete outjockeyed his previous record by running faster than ever before.
meanings.sent2: She outjockeyed her classmates in the spelling bee by correctly spelling every word.
meanings.sent3: The little engine outjockeyed the bigger trains by chugging along steadily and winning the race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outjockey her rivals fueled her to train harder and achieve victory.
meanings.sent5: The underdog team outjockeyed the reigning champions, surprising everyone with their skill and teamwork.
